stories.text:
I was wondering what code reviews look like on other teams. Iâ€™ve only been in one role and exposed to one workflow that the team uses, how does your team do it?

For our team we do a series of reviews with a lower level engineer, then send it up to our lead engineer to review, at this stage it can go back and fourth several times until something is merged in.
stories.title: Ask HN: How does your team do code reviews?

stories.text:
Tested on Void Linux with musl

NetBSD's progress(1) has different aesthetics and at least one unique advantange, IMO, compared to other progress meters: it detects whether it is in the running foreground and allows the user to background and foreground the process more "cleanly".
stories.title: Port of NetBSD 9 progress(1) to other systems
